Build: TPTP-4.2.0-200511151052
Platform: Windows

When launching automated test suite using this build, an RAC error message 
showed up:

java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/eclipse/core/runtime/IProgressMonitor
        at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethods0(Native Method)
        at java.lang.Class.privateGetDeclaredMethods(Unknown Source)
        at java.lang.Class.getDeclaredMethod(Unknown Source)
        at 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.e
xecuteCommand(FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.java:126)
        at 
org.eclipse.hyades.internal.collection.framework.FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.r
un(FileClientHandlerExtendedImpl.java:272)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)

The test suite failed to launch, and the progress bar stuck at 57% ( on my 
machine).

TPTP driver works fine with 20051109 RAC driver.

Same problem occurs while running the manual test suite also.
Progress bar stuck at 57%

(build: TPTP-4.2.0-200511151052)

This has been seen in the past when there were problems with the RAC builds
(missing JARs from the install or malformed serviceconfig.xml).  Basically the
file transfer server is looking for the IProgressMonitor from the Eclipse
runtime.jar but cannot find it.  I will investigate this build.

I just noticed this was found with a 4.2 build.  I will re-assign target
milestone appropriately.

The issue is that the runtime.jar has been renamed to
org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.1.0.v20051027.jar in the RAC plugins directory --
please edit the config/serviceconfig.xml file for a workaround.  Change the line:

  <Variable name="CLASSPATH_ORG_ECLIPSE_CORE_RUNTIME" position="append"
value="%PLUGINS_HOME%\org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.1.0.jar" /> 

To point to the newly renamed runtime jar mentioned in the first paragraph above
-- after this the runtime should be able to resolve the IProgressMonitor classes
and others.  This is just a workarond, for TPTP 4.2, this defect will track
fixing this in the SetConfig file.
Fixed SetConfig.java to generate proper JAR path in serviceconfig.xml.
